awd_abstract_narration: The University of Nebraska will undertake a project to create                   computer-based chemistry lesson planning tools for use in                       secondary science methods courses.  The project will assemble                   a database of chemistry lessons and activities which will be                    accessed through HyperCard for lesson planning.  The lesson                     planning tools will be created by merging existing databases,                   such as Doing Chemistry and MicroScale, with contributions                      from secondary science methods teachers and practicing high                     school chemistry teachers.  The tools may be personalized and                   adapted to individual teaching styles and approaches.  CAI                      materials showing how to use the tools for preservice                           secondary methods students will also be developed.  The                         software will be distributed free of cost to every secondary                    science methods instructor in the United States.  The cost                      sharing by the university and other sources will be 38% of                      NSF's contribution.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA
